sections.heading: 2. COURSE DESCRIPTIONS
content: The course provides foundational knowledge on system analysis and design and object-oriented analysis design. The content of the course includes: the concepts of system, information system, system development life cycle, system development team, development methods system development, software development process, unified modeling language UML; Survey the system and initialize a system development project; Business modeling, structure and behavior modeling of system; architecture design, user interface design, class and data design.

The course also aims to develop critical thinking skills, the ability to self-learn knowledge, and technologies related to system analysis and design by working independently as well as in groups. Students will be divided into groups to delve deeper into various technologies, allowing them to present and discuss individual or group solutions to address issues.

content: Students are responsible for attending all classes. In case of absence from school due to force majeure reasons, sufficient and reasonable proofs must be provided. For each absence, 1 point will be deducted 1 point. Students who miss any classes more than 3 times, with or without reason, will be considered as failing to complete the course and have to re-register.
Students will be awarded points for constructive comments these points are added to attendance points and group assignments.

2. COURSE DESCRIPTIONS 
The course provides foundational knowledge on system analysis and design and object-oriented analysis design. The content of the course includes: the concepts of system, information system, system development life cycle, system development team, development methods system development, software development process, unified modeling language UML; Survey the system and initialize a system development project; Business modeling, structure and behavior modeling of system; architecture design, user interface design, class and data design.
The course also aims to develop critical thinking skills, the ability to self-learn knowledge, and technologies related to system analysis and design by working independently as well as in groups. Students will be divided into groups to delve deeper into various technologies, allowing them to present and discuss individual or group solutions to address issues.
3. LEARNING RESOURCES 
* Textbooks/Lecture Notes: 
[1]. Dennis – Wixom – Tegarden (2020), System Analysis and Design: An Object-Oriented Approach with UML, Wiley.
[2]. Nguyen Van Ba (2008), Developing object-oriented systems with UML 2.0 and C++, Hanoi National University Publishing House
* Additional references:
[3]. Nguyen Van Ba (2006) Analysis and design of information systems, National University Press.
[4]. Kenneth E. Kendall Julie E. Kendall (2020), Systems analysis and design, Pearson.
[5]. Dennis – Wixom – Roth (2020), System Analysis and Design, John Wiley & Sons, Inc.

8. COURSE REQUIREMENT & EXPECTATION
8.1. Requirements for taking final /terminal exams
Students are allowed to take the final exam if their attendance score reaches 5 points or more (on the scale of 10).
8.2. Requirements for attending classes
Students are responsible for attending all classes. In case of absence from school due to force majeure reasons, sufficient and reasonable proofs must be provided. For each absence, 1 point will be deducted 1 point. Students who miss any classes more than 3 times, with or without reason, will be considered as failing to complete the course and have to re-register.
Students will be awarded points for constructive comments these points are added to attendance points and group assignments.
Groups who do not submit the group work will receive a score of 0 (zero). Late submissions will be deducted for each day of late submission.
8.3. Requirements for in-class behaviour
The course is conducted on the principle of respecting learners and lecturers. Any behaviour that affects the teaching and learning process is strictly prohibited.
Students must come to class on time. Students who are late more than 10 minutes after class starts will not be allowed to attend the class. Do not make noise and affect others during the learning process.
Laptops and tablets are only used for the purpose of taking notes for and calculating for lectures and exercises, absolutely forbidden to use for other purposes.
